name: Four Seasons Hotel Philadelphia

reviews.text: Service, furnishings and the atmosphere at the Four Seasons at Philadelphia were again terrific. This time, the family came and we had a suite.
reviews.title: Great Service at the Four Seasons

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Covering off the basics first, all Four Seasons' rooms are on the small side - even the suites. What you're paying for is the service, room furnishings, beds and toiletries which are all first class. If you are not planning to use the services - room service, concierge, bellman - then perhaps stay elsewhere. But if you want the full experience, the Four Seasons Philadelphia staff continue to live up to their reputation of remembering your name and providing outstanding, proactive service.
reviews.title: Good experience, however....

reviews.text: The only clanger was that Hi speed internet was an extra $10/day - time to get with the times and start providing your travellers with what they need for the cost of the rooms. Particularly when the hotel used to provide the service free in the lobby, but has stopped.
reviews.title: Suprisingly Great With Kids
Not the best location - but the best hotel in Philly
reviews.text: I continue to recommend the Four Seasons Philadelphia, but only 4 stars until the Internet is included.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the hotel with my wife as an anniversary gift while I was taking my LSAT at Temple University. We did the breakfast with the room deal and the food was delicious! However, when I made a spa massage appointment for her, they neglected to confirm the appointment to me (something I found out later) and so when she went down there, they do not have her on their schedule. They still took her for another service though, but nevertheless damage was done. Overall the experience was good, and the staff was extremely friendly. Just make sure you get a confirmation for your hotel activities.
reviews.title: Top Scores Across the Board

reviews.text: We stayed at the FS Philladelphia for New Years Eve. What a wonderful hotel. The staff is gracious and attentive, we always felt like we were taken care of without being hovered over. Check in went smoothly and we were shown to lovely room with a view of the Parkway. The furnishings were in true FS form, elegent and classic. The bed was very comfortable and of course the bath was the best part of the whole room. We had some appetizers and drinks in the bar area before heading out to our dinner in the city. The items were pricey (it is the FS after all) but good. While there, we decided to inquire about reservations for their famous Sunday brunch the next day (I had requested the brunch upon making my reservation, only to find it had been booked for forever). An extremely helpful waiter made some inquires and eventually the manager came over and instructed us to arrive early and request a table and the staff should be able to squeeze us in. We did just that and were not disappointed - we were quickly seated and the brunch was to die for. The brunch staff was excellent, always there with coffee or juice at just the right time and each time we went up to the buffet we arrived back to a table that looked as though we had never sat there. All in all it, was a fantastic stay and I would definately go back.
reviews.title: Great New Years Stay
I Love the Four Seasons!!!
reviews.text: After staying at the Miami and Chicago Four Seasons hotels, I checked in to the Four Seasons Hotel Philadelphia with my kids with high expectations. We came in for the Red Sox/Phillies games on May 19-21. This hotel did not dissapoint me. Here are the main highlights of the hotel.

reviews.title: Check-in still a problem
reviews.text: Lobby, Public Areas, etc.- The lobby was beautiful with all marble flooring and luxurious furniture. It was lively and festive, but not too crazy. The elevators, hallways in the hotel, and common areas were very clean and also very luxuriously appointed.

Rooms- The rooms and suites in the hotel were just renovated, and are very luxurious with marble bathrooms (jsut like any other Four Seasons), out of this world beds (i mean amazingly comfortable), a cd clock radio with soft jazz playing when we entered the room, and again luxurious appointments and furniture.
reviews.title: Recommend it
Disorganized Check-In
reviews.text: Service- Four Seasons Hotels and Resorts have the best service in the entire world, because no is just not in their vocabulary. They will always help you with a request and assist you (especially the concierge). It makes your stay so much more enjoyable.

reviews.title: Four Seasons
reviews.text: My husband and I recently spent a weekend at the Four Seasons in Philadelphia. Having previously stayed at The Rittenhouse (couldn't get a reservation there) we expected a similar level of quality and sevice. It was not the case. We were kindly upgraded to a suite which was nice but not spectacular. We had dinner in The Fountain Restaurant which was very good but extremely expensive. The room service menu is limited and also extremely expensive (I stay in alot of first class hotels and the prices here are high). Took advantage of their spa twice and it was fine although nothing too special. Overall, it is a nice hotel but not the quality you would expect for a 4-Seasons.I wouldn't stay there again, there are a lot of excellent options in Philadelphia.

description: A deluxe property with wonderful views of Philadelphia.
